messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Urgent_Royal armouries Bushido event UK
messages.msgSnippet: HI If I take my camera I will send you all the pics I take paul ...     Hi Paul,       Would you happen to
messages.messageBody:
HI

If I take my camera I will send you all the pics I
take

paul


--- gerald.divinagracia@... wrote:

<HR>
<html><body>


<tt>
<BR>
Hi Paul,<BR>
      Would you happen to
take some pictures? If you will.....kindly send<BR>
some to us.....unfortunately I'm in a different
country (Philippines) and<BR>
although I would love to go to Japan to see it.....but
work schedule<BR>
prohibits it. But should you have pictures....please
share them to us, if<BR>
that's okay with you. Thanks so much!<BR>
<BR>
Regards,<BR>
************************************<BR>
Gerald G. Divinagracia<BR>
Accenture<BR>
Manila Development Centre<BR>
(632) 849-5571<BR>
Octel. 5571<BR>
gerald.divinagracia@...<BR>
************************************<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
                                                                                                                                
<BR>
             
Richardson
Paul                                                                                                   
<BR>
             
<umaryu@...>            
To:     
samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com                                          
<BR>
                                              
cc:                                                                              
<BR>
             
10/22/2002 10:53
PM             
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Urgent_Royal armouries
Bushido event
UK            
<BR>
             
Please respond
to                                                                                                 
<BR>
             
samuraihistory                                                                                                    
<BR>
                                                                                                                                
<BR>
                                                                                                                                
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
HI Mark<BR>
<BR>
I am attending next Sunday 28th.<BR>
<BR>
Some of my mates went this sunday gone and they
loved<BR>
it<BR>
<BR>
paul<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
--- samurai182uk <samurai182uk@...>
wrote:<BR>
<BR>
<HR><BR>
<html><body><BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<tt><BR>
Hi all<BR><BR>
<BR><BR>
I have just found out about an event at the royal<BR>
armouries, called <BR><BR>
Bushido. It is a major exhibition improving on the<BR>
already excellent <BR><BR>
Oriental gallery at the Royal armouries museum
Leeds.<BR>
The event will <BR><BR>
include mounted horse archery which will be a real<BR>
spectacle to <BR><BR>
behold. I am very excited about this, is anyone
else<BR>
going to go <BR><BR>
maybe, we could all meet up, heres the info anyhow<BR>
copied from website<BR><BR>
www.armouries.org/leeds/what's_on/special.html<BR><BR>
<BR><BR>
19 to 28 October   ''Bushido': The
Way of<BR>
the Warrior <BR><BR>
A celebration of the splendour of Japan and its
many<BR>
customs. Take <BR><BR>
part in our Samurai school, be amazed by Japanese<BR>
horse archery, and <BR><BR>
enjoy a tour of the Oriental gallery. There will be
a<BR>
handling <BR><BR>
collection so visitors can get a real feel for the<BR>
culture and <BR><BR>
oriental themed children's activities. <BR><BR>
<BR><BR>
All the best Mark<BR><BR>
<BR><BR>
<BR><BR>
</tt><BR>
<BR>
<br><BR>
<BR>

messages.subject: Re: Urgent_Royal armouries Bushido event UK
messages.msgSnippet: ... I have been loads of times, but I am also going on the weekend again 27-28th not decided, maybe Sunday, It is mostly the Yabusame that I want to see. But
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@y..., Richardson Paul <umaryu@y...> wrote:
> HI Mark
>
> I am attending next Sunday 28th.
>
> Some of my mates went this sunday gone and they loved
> it
>
> paul
--------------------------------------------------------------------

I have been loads of times, but I am also going on the weekend again
27-28th not decided, maybe Sunday,
It is mostly the Yabusame that I want to see. But The Oriental
gallery is excellent. I have made a flag (a mini Sashimono) of the
Soma family-due to horse riding connections-Yabusame-horse archery. I
will probably look damn silly, but I don't care, because, We should
support events like this as enthusiastically as possible NE? Ok then,
If you see someone with a flag of Soma family, One large circle eight
small ones around it. Feel free to stop and chat. Or run away in
Terror.

all the best Mark

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Urgent_Royal armouries Bushido event UK
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Paul, Would you happen to take some pictures? If you will.....kindly send some to us.....unfortunately I m in a different country (Philippines) and although
messages.messageBody:
Hi Paul,
Would you happen to take some pictures? If you will.....kindly send
some to us.....unfortunately I'm in a different country (Philippines) and
although I would love to go to Japan to see it.....but work schedule
prohibits it. But should you have pictures....please share them to us, if
that's okay with you. Thanks so much!

Regards,
************************************
Gerald G. Divinagracia
Accenture
Manila Development Centre
(632) 849-5571
Octel. 5571
gerald.divinagracia@...
************************************



Richardson Paul
<umaryu@...> To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
cc:
10/22/2002 10:53 PM Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Urgent_Royal armouries Bushido event UK
Please respond to
samuraihistory




HI Mark

I am attending next Sunday 28th.

Some of my mates went this sunday gone and they loved
it

paul

<HR>
<html><body>


<tt>
Hi all<BR>
<BR>
I have just found out about an event at the royal
armouries, called <BR>
Bushido. It is a major exhibition improving on the
already excellent <BR>
Oriental gallery at the Royal armouries museum Leeds.
The event will <BR>
include mounted horse archery which will be a real
spectacle to <BR>
behold. I am very excited about this, is anyone else
going to go <BR>
maybe, we could all meet up, heres the info anyhow
copied from website<BR>
www.armouries.org/leeds/what's_on/special.html<BR>
<BR>
19 to 28 October   ''Bushido': The Way of
the Warrior <BR>
A celebration of the splendour of Japan and its many
customs. Take <BR>
part in our Samurai school, be amazed by Japanese
horse archery, and <BR>
enjoy a tour of the Oriental gallery. There will be a
handling <BR>
collection so visitors can get a real feel for the
culture and <BR>
oriental themed children's activities. <BR>
<BR>
All the best Mark<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
</tt>

<br>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Urgent_Royal armouries Bushido event UK
messages.msgSnippet: Ryozen Rekishikan- Tell Kimura san Big Tom sent you. Be sure to give yourself an hour to walk in the graveyard on the hillside above the Museum. All the
messages.messageBody:
Ryozen Rekishikan-

Tell Kimura san "Big Tom" sent you. Be sure to give yourself an hour to walk in the graveyard on
the hillside above the Museum. All the shishi who died in Kyoto during the Bakumatsu are there
including Sakamoto Ryoma and Nakaoka Shintaro.
Also look for the book "Ryoma no Kyo" for 2000 yen it is a great guide to Bakumatsu related
sites in Kyoto-
Tom

www.ryozen-museum.or.jp

messages.subject: Urgent_Royal armouries Bushido event UK
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all I have just found out about an event at the royal armouries, called Bushido. It is a major exhibition improving on the already excellent Oriental
messages.messageBody:
Hi all

I have just found out about an event at the royal armouries, called
Bushido. It is a major exhibition improving on the already excellent
Oriental gallery at the Royal armouries museum Leeds. The event will
include mounted horse archery which will be a real spectacle to
behold. I am very excited about this, is anyone else going to go
maybe, we could all meet up, heres the info anyhow copied from website
www.armouries.org/leeds/what's_on/special.html

19 to 28 October ''Bushido': The Way of the Warrior
A celebration of the splendour of Japan and its many customs. Take
part in our Samurai school, be amazed by Japanese horse archery, and
enjoy a tour of the Oriental gallery. There will be a handling
collection so visitors can get a real feel for the culture and
oriental themed children's activities.

All the best Mark
